Utilities required for processing polarimetry data

This function implements Planck Collaboration 2016 method to calculates the angular dispersion of the region

Utilities.Calc_l(ra1, dec1, ra2, dec2)

The function calculates the distance between two points on the celestial plane

Parameters

  • ra1 (float) – RA coordinate of first position in degrees

  • dec1 (float) – DEC coordinate of first position in degrees

  • ra2 (float) – RA coordinate of second position in degrees

  • dec2 (float) – DEC coordinate of second position in degrees

Returns

returns the seperation in arcminutes between the two points on the celestial sphere

Return type

seperation (float)

Utilities.generate_RA_DEC_mesh(hdu)

Given the fits file HDU the function generates the RA and DEC grids

Parameters

hdu (astropy fits) – RA coordinate at which to search

Returns

DEC grid for the given fits file RA_grid (2D array): RA grid for the given fits file

Return type

DEC_grid (2D array)

Utilities.paramters_search(ra_coord, dec_coord)

parameters_search

Given RA and DEC coordinates this program finds the parallax and distance using GAIA data release 3

Parameters

  • ra_coord (float) – RA coordinate at which to search

  • dec_coord (float) – DEC coordinate at which to search

Returns

(float): Gaia parallax of the object at the given RA and DEC dist: (float): Hipparcos distance to the object at the given RA and DEC search_width (float): Search area in which object was found

Return type

parallax

Utilities.quality_cuts(stokesI, stokesIerr, Pol, Polerr, SNRp_cut, p_cut, SNRi_cut)

The function does the signal to noise ratio qualtity cuts for polarizaiton fraction.

Parameters

  • stokesI (astropy.io.fits.PrimaryHDU) – The Stokes I file in astropy.io.fits.PrimaryHDU.

  • stokesIerr (astropy.io.fits.PrimaryHDU) – The error in Stokes I file in astropy.io.fits.PrimaryHDU.

  • Pol (astropy.io.fits.PrimaryHDU) – The Polarization fraction in astropy.io.fits.PrimaryHDU format.

  • Polerr (astropy.io.fits.PrimaryHDU) – The error in Polarization fraction in astropy.io.fits.PrimaryHDU format.

  • SNRp_cut (float) – Signal to noise ratio cutoff for Polarizaiton fraction.

  • p_cut – Maximum value cutoff for Polarizaiton fraction.

Returns

The filtered Polarization fraction in astropy.io.fits.PrimaryHDU format.

Return type

Pol (astropy.io.fits.PrimaryHDU)

Utilities.remove_nan(array1, array2)

The function removes the NAN values in two arrays to create modified arrays of same size. Useful for removing NAN values in two arrays with one being the function of other

Parameters

  • array1 (numpy array) – first array to be filtered

  • array2 (numpy array) – Second array to be filtered

Returns

first array filtered array2_fil (numpy array): Second array filtered

Return type

array1_fil (numpy array)

Utilities.wrapper(Angle_grid)

The function keeps the polarization angles in a array between -90 and 90

Parameters

Angle_grid (N-D numpy array) – N dimensional array consisting of polarization angles

Returns

N dimensional array consisting of modified polarization angles

Return type

Angle_grid (N-D numpy array)
